caption: Beautiful modern church near Bastille and in 11th arondissment. Peaceful.

Kind of strange to write a review of a church, but we attended Mass here on a recent Sunday (speaking very little French; we're American), but enjoyed it very much. Peaceful (open doors) during the week, and friendly on Sunday.
You need to do something about the bells ringing every hour. Specially on the weekends, it‚Äôs unbearable for the neighbours. We need to rest!
This is a modern style church in Paris.
Church built in 1998. Very modern appearance. Do not hesitate to enter, it asks to be visited. In particular a magnificent statue of the Virgin.
It is a very small church located in a very busy and noisy place. However, it is almost invisible. The interior is very sober.

Very beautiful, sober church, on the street but open to all! everything is magnificent in art: the cross, the chapel etc. and above all an atmosphere, no offense to certain commentators, very fervent and a priest of fire to encourage speech and communion between all. THANKS

A Jewel of Modernity and Peace in the Heart of Paris  Rating: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ  Text of the notice: The Notre-Dame d'Esp√©rance church, located on rue de la Roquette in Paris, is a true masterpiece of modernity and living history. This church is unlike any other; it is a symbol of renewal and hope in the midst of the bustle of the city.  The most striking element of this church is undoubtedly the Cross of Hope, a masterful work by Nicolas Alquin. Carved from an 18th century oak beam, this cross represents both the Incarnation of Christ and his Resurrection, symbolized by three gold squares forming an invisible cross. This representation, devoid of any suffering, invites you to a moment of deep meditation and inner peace.  The current church, consecrated in 1997, is distinguished by its brightness and contemporary style, contrasting with traditional religious buildings. Each architectural element seems designed to invite contemplation and serenity.  The Bastille district, where the church is located, is steeped in history. Once occupied by a Cistercian abbey and a neighborhood of artisans, it played a key role in the Revolution of 1789. This historical richness is felt in the atmosphere of the church, which seems to connect the past and the present in a harmonious way .  The Notre-Dame d'Esp√©rance church is also the fruit of a long history of social dedication, initiated by Father Jean-√âmile Anizan, and perpetuated by the congregation of the Sons of Charity. This social heritage is felt in the warm welcome and the vocation of the church to be a refuge for all.  In conclusion, the Notre-Dame d‚ÄôEsp√©rance church is much more than a place of worship. It is a space of calm and reflection, a meeting point between art, history and spirituality. A visit is essential for anyone looking for a moment of peace in the vibrant city of Paris.
Modern church that looks more like a gymnasium than a place of Christianity. We don't feel the religious side.
I passed by at dinner time and went in to take a look. The bishop and staff were very friendly in introducing and communicating with each other.

This ‚Äúchurch‚Äù seems like some kind of soulless American evangelical house of worship. I didn't feel any spirituality there. It looks like a waiting room at a dentist's office or branch of some administrative location. Avoid if you believe in God.
Rare church porch wide open onto the street, and beautiful architecture in stone and wood, chapel of the Holy Sacrament decorated with a Stations of the Cross in marble bas reliefs.

This church is very small with the two open doors which allow all passers-by to see the entire interior with the font in the center when entering. Let's hope that security is there when we see all the people hanging out in the street.
